p: Subsequent research showed that some of the safrole derivatives were unable to inhibit cell growth, and the antiproliferative effects of these compounds were not only due to the presence of the benzodiaxol ring ( Moreira et al., 2007). Epoxy group in the chain is another part of the molecule which increases cytotoxicity in benzodioxole structures. For instance a metabolite of safrole (safrole 2, 3-oxide), induced more potent genotoxic and cytotoxic effects than safrole ( Moreira et al., 2007; Chiang et al., 2011).
